title: e-SafeFoods Workshop
text:
REGISTRATION

The workshop is free-of-charge, but it has a maximum number of participants of 40.
Certificates will be provided to participants.
Registration is done by completing the registration form.
For further information, e-mail Ursula Gonzales-Barron: ubarron@ipb.pt

title: e-SafeFoods Workshop
text:
IMPORTANT

In case of non-attendance, please cancel registration at the earliest by sending an email to ubarron@ipb.pt

title: e-SafeFoods Workshop
text:
AIM OF THE WORKSHOP
At the end of the workshop, the participant will have notions of:

the modelling of microbiological challenge test data, and the importance of validation;
how to exploit microbial kinetic parameters obtained from predictive microbiology models in the validation of a process and, ultimately, in the assessment of exposure to foodborne pathogens.

title: e-SafeFoods Workshop
text:
AUDIENCE
The intended audience for this workshop includes Master/PhD students, researchers and academic staff who have an interest in the analysis and exploitability of data obtained from microbiological challenge tests.
Maximum participants: The face-to-face workshop accommodates a maximum of 40 trainees in order to maintain interactive work and discussion.

title: e-SafeFoods Workshop
text:
The Workshop Making the Most of Microbiological Challenge Test Data will take place on the \(30^{th}\) April 2024 at the Polytechnic Institute of Bragança (Portugal). The Workshop is organised as a training event within the Erasmus+ Programme e-SafeFood project, whose main objective is to develop online training programmes on microbiological food risks with a strong practical component and certified at European level.
Making the Most of Microbiological Challenge Test Data is a free-of-charge face-to-face three-hour workshop, but registration is required.

title: e-SafeFoods Workshop
text:
HOW TO GET THERE?

The following bus companies travel Porto - Bragança - Porto.

Santos (online schedules and fares: https://www.santosviagensturismo.pt/pt/)

title: e-SafeFoods Workshop
text:
VIRTUAL ATTENDANCE IS NOW POSSIBLE

The Workshop Making the Most of Microbiological Challenge Test Data will take place in two modalities: physical attendance and virtual participation via ZOOM, on the \(30^{th}\) April 2024. The Workshop location is the School of Agriculture of the Polytechnic Institute of Bragança (Portugal), and is organised as a training event within the Erasmus+ Programme e-SafeFood project, whose main objective is to develop online training programmes on microbiological food risks with a strong practical component and certified at European level.
Making the Most of Microbiological Challenge Test Data is a free-of-charge three-hour workshop, but registration is required. Participants must indicate their participation modality.

Making the Most of Microbiological Challenge Test Data is a free-of-charge three-hour workshop, but registration is required. Participants must indicate their participation modality.
